1// SPC emulation support: init, sample buffering, reset, SPC loading
2
3// snes_spc 0.9.0. http://www.slack.net/~ant/
4
5#include "SNES_SPC.h"
6
7#include <string.h>

20#include "blargg_source.h"
21
22#define RAM (m.ram.ram)
23#define REGS (m.smp_regs [0])
24#define REGS_IN (m.smp_regs [1])
25
26// (n ? n : 256)
27#define IF_0_THEN_256( n ) ((uint8_t) ((n) - 1) + 1)
28
29
30//// Init
31
32blargg_err_t SNES_SPC::init()
33{
34 memset( &m, 0, sizeof m );
35 dsp.init( RAM );
36
37 m.tempo = tempo_unit;
38
39 // Most SPC music doesn't need ROM, and almost all the rest only rely
40 // on these two bytes
41 m.rom [0x3E] = 0xFF;
42 m.rom [0x3F] = 0xC0;
43
44 static unsigned char const cycle_table [128] =
45 {// 01 23 45 67 89 AB CD EF
46 0x28,0x47,0x34,0x36,0x26,0x54,0x54,0x68, // 0
47 0x48,0x47,0x45,0x56,0x55,0x65,0x22,0x46, // 1
48 0x28,0x47,0x34,0x36,0x26,0x54,0x54,0x74, // 2
49 0x48,0x47,0x45,0x56,0x55,0x65,0x22,0x38, // 3
50 0x28,0x47,0x34,0x36,0x26,0x44,0x54,0x66, // 4
51 0x48,0x47,0x45,0x56,0x55,0x45,0x22,0x43, // 5
52 0x28,0x47,0x34,0x36,0x26,0x44,0x54,0x75, // 6
53 0x48,0x47,0x45,0x56,0x55,0x55,0x22,0x36, // 7
54 0x28,0x47,0x34,0x36,0x26,0x54,0x52,0x45, // 8
55 0x48,0x47,0x45,0x56,0x55,0x55,0x22,0xC5, // 9
56 0x38,0x47,0x34,0x36,0x26,0x44,0x52,0x44, // A
57 0x48,0x47,0x45,0x56,0x55,0x55,0x22,0x34, // B
58 0x38,0x47,0x45,0x47,0x25,0x64,0x52,0x49, // C
59 0x48,0x47,0x56,0x67,0x45,0x55,0x22,0x83, // D
60 0x28,0x47,0x34,0x36,0x24,0x53,0x43,0x40, // E
61 0x48,0x47,0x45,0x56,0x34,0x54,0x22,0x60, // F
62 };
63
64 // unpack cycle table
65 for ( int i = 0; i < 128; i++ )
66 {
67 int n = cycle_table [i];
68 m.cycle_table [i * 2 + 0] = n >> 4;
69 m.cycle_table [i * 2 + 1] = n & 0x0F;
70 }
71
72 #if SPC_LESS_ACCURATE
73 memcpy( reg_times, reg_times_, sizeof reg_times );
74 #endif
75
76 reset();
77 return 0;
78}
79
80void SNES_SPC::init_rom( uint8_t const in [rom_size] )
81{
82 memcpy( m.rom, in, sizeof m.rom );
83}
84
85void SNES_SPC::set_tempo( int t )
86{
87 m.tempo = t;
88 int const timer2_shift = 4; // 64 kHz
89 int const other_shift = 3; // 8 kHz
90
91 #if SPC_DISABLE_TEMPO
92 m.timers [2].prescaler = timer2_shift;
93 m.timers [1].prescaler = timer2_shift + other_shift;
94 m.timers [0].prescaler = timer2_shift + other_shift;
95 #else
96 if ( !t )
97 t = 1;
98 int const timer2_rate = 1 << timer2_shift;
99 int rate = (timer2_rate * tempo_unit + (t >> 1)) / t;
100 if ( rate < timer2_rate / 4 )
101 rate = timer2_rate / 4; // max 4x tempo
102 m.timers [2].prescaler = rate;
103 m.timers [1].prescaler = rate << other_shift;
104 m.timers [0].prescaler = rate << other_shift;
105 #endif
106}
107
108// Timer registers have been loaded. Applies these to the timers. Does not
109// reset timer prescalers or dividers.
110void SNES_SPC::timers_loaded()
111{
112 int i;
113 for ( i = 0; i < timer_count; i++ )
114 {
115 Timer* t = &m.timers [i];
116 t->period = IF_0_THEN_256( REGS [r_t0target + i] );
117 t->enabled = REGS [r_control] >> i & 1;
118 t->counter = REGS_IN [r_t0out + i] & 0x0F;
119 }
120
121 set_tempo( m.tempo );
122}
123
124// Loads registers from unified 16-byte format
125void SNES_SPC::load_regs( uint8_t const in [reg_count] )
126{
127 memcpy( REGS, in, reg_count );
128 memcpy( REGS_IN, REGS, reg_count );
129
130 // These always read back as 0
131 REGS_IN [r_test ] = 0;
132 REGS_IN [r_control ] = 0;
133 REGS_IN [r_t0target] = 0;
134 REGS_IN [r_t1target] = 0;
135 REGS_IN [r_t2target] = 0;
136}
137
138// RAM was just loaded from SPC, with $F0-$FF containing SMP registers
139// and timer counts. Copies these to proper registers.
140void SNES_SPC::ram_loaded()
141{
142 m.rom_enabled = 0;
143 load_regs( &RAM [0xF0] );
144
145 // Put STOP instruction around memory to catch PC underflow/overflow
146 memset( m.ram.padding1, cpu_pad_fill, sizeof m.ram.padding1 );
147 memset( m.ram.ram + 0x10000, cpu_pad_fill, sizeof m.ram.ram - 0x10000 );
148}
149// Registers were just loaded. Applies these new values.
150void SNES_SPC::regs_loaded()
151{
152 enable_rom( REGS [r_control] & 0x80 );
153 timers_loaded();
154}
155
156void SNES_SPC::reset_time_regs()
157{
158 m.cpu_error = 0;
159 m.echo_accessed = 0;
160 m.spc_time = 0;
161 m.dsp_time = 0;
162 #if SPC_LESS_ACCURATE
163 m.dsp_time = clocks_per_sample + 1;
164 #endif
165
166 for ( int i = 0; i < timer_count; i++ )
167 {
168 Timer* t = &m.timers [i];
169 t->next_time = 1;
170 t->divider = 0;
171 }
172
173 regs_loaded();
174
175 m.extra_clocks = 0;
176 reset_buf();
177}
178
179void SNES_SPC::reset_common( int timer_counter_init )
180{
181 int i;
182 for ( i = 0; i < timer_count; i++ )
183 REGS_IN [r_t0out + i] = timer_counter_init;
184
185 // Run IPL ROM
186 memset( &m.cpu_regs, 0, sizeof m.cpu_regs );
187 m.cpu_regs.pc = rom_addr;
188
189 REGS [r_test ] = 0x0A;
190 REGS [r_control] = 0xB0; // ROM enabled, clear ports
191 for ( i = 0; i < port_count; i++ )
192 REGS_IN [r_cpuio0 + i] = 0;
193
194 reset_time_regs();
195}
196
197void SNES_SPC::soft_reset()
198{
199 reset_common( 0 );
200 dsp.soft_reset();
201}
202
203void SNES_SPC::reset()
204{
205 memset( RAM, 0xFF, 0x10000 );
206 ram_loaded();
207 reset_common( 0x0F );
208 dsp.reset();
209}
210
211char const SNES_SPC::signature [signature_size + 1] =
212 "SNES-SPC700 Sound File Data v0.30\x1A\x1A";
213
214blargg_err_t SNES_SPC::load_spc( void const* data, long size )
215{
216 spc_file_t const* const spc = (spc_file_t const*) data;
217
218 // be sure compiler didn't insert any padding into fle_t
219 assert( sizeof (spc_file_t) == spc_min_file_size + 0x80 );
220
221 // Check signature and file size
222 if ( size < signature_size || memcmp( spc, signature, 27 ) )
223 return "Not an SPC file";
224
225 if ( size < spc_min_file_size )
226 return "Corrupt SPC file";
227
228 // CPU registers
229 m.cpu_regs.pc = spc->pch * 0x100 + spc->pcl;
230 m.cpu_regs.a = spc->a;
231 m.cpu_regs.x = spc->x;
232 m.cpu_regs.y = spc->y;
233 m.cpu_regs.psw = spc->psw;
234 m.cpu_regs.sp = spc->sp;
235
236 // RAM and registers
237 memcpy( RAM, spc->ram, 0x10000 );
238 ram_loaded();
239
240 // DSP registers
241 dsp.load( spc->dsp );
242
243 reset_time_regs();
244
245 return 0;
246}
247
248void SNES_SPC::clear_echo()
249{
250 if ( !(dsp.read( SPC_DSP::r_flg ) & 0x20) )
251 {
252 int addr = 0x100 * dsp.read( SPC_DSP::r_esa );
253 int end = addr + 0x800 * (dsp.read( SPC_DSP::r_edl ) & 0x0F);
254 if ( end > 0x10000 )
255 end = 0x10000;
256 memset( &RAM [addr], 0xFF, end - addr );
257 }
258}
259
260
261//// Sample output
262
263void SNES_SPC::reset_buf()
264{
265 // Start with half extra buffer of silence
266 sample_t* out = m.extra_buf;
267 while ( out < &m.extra_buf [extra_size / 2] )
268 *out++ = 0;
269
270 m.extra_pos = out;
271 m.buf_begin = 0;
272
273 dsp.set_output( 0, 0 );
274}
275
276void SNES_SPC::set_output( sample_t* out, int size )
277{
278 require( (size & 1) == 0 ); // size must be even
279
280 m.extra_clocks &= clocks_per_sample - 1;
281 if ( out )
282 {
283 sample_t const* out_end = out + size;
284 m.buf_begin = out;
285 m.buf_end = out_end;
286
287 // Copy extra to output
288 sample_t const* in = m.extra_buf;
289 while ( in < m.extra_pos && out < out_end )
290 *out++ = *in++;
291
292 // Handle output being full already
293 if ( out >= out_end )
294 {
295 // Have DSP write to remaining extra space
296 out = dsp.extra();
297 out_end = &dsp.extra() [extra_size];
298
299 // Copy any remaining extra samples as if DSP wrote them
300 while ( in < m.extra_pos )
301 *out++ = *in++;
302 assert( out <= out_end );
303 }
304
305 dsp.set_output( out, int(out_end - out) );
306 }
307 else
308 {
309 reset_buf();
310 }
311}
312
313void SNES_SPC::save_extra()
314{
315 // Get end pointers
316 sample_t const* main_end = m.buf_end; // end of data written to buf
317 sample_t const* dsp_end = dsp.out_pos(); // end of data written to dsp.extra()
318 if ( m.buf_begin <= dsp_end && dsp_end <= main_end )
319 {
320 main_end = dsp_end;
321 dsp_end = dsp.extra(); // nothing in DSP's extra
322 }
323
324 // Copy any extra samples at these ends into extra_buf
325 sample_t* out = m.extra_buf;
326 sample_t const* in;
327 for ( in = m.buf_begin + sample_count(); in < main_end; in++ )
328 *out++ = *in;
329 for ( in = dsp.extra(); in < dsp_end ; in++ )
330 *out++ = *in;
331
332 m.extra_pos = out;
333 assert( out <= &m.extra_buf [extra_size] );
334}
335
336blargg_err_t SNES_SPC::play( int count, sample_t* out )
337{
338 require( (count & 1) == 0 ); // must be even
339 if ( count )
340 {
341 set_output( out, count );
342 end_frame( count * (clocks_per_sample / 2) );
343 }
344
345 const char* err = m.cpu_error;
346 m.cpu_error = 0;
347 return err;
348}
349
350blargg_err_t SNES_SPC::skip( int count )
351{
352 #if SPC_LESS_ACCURATE
353 if ( count > 2 * sample_rate * 2 )
354 {
355 set_output( 0, 0 );
356
357 // Skip a multiple of 4 samples
358 time_t end = count;
359 count = (count & 3) + 1 * sample_rate * 2;
360 end = (end - count) * (clocks_per_sample / 2);
361
362 m.skipped_kon = 0;
363 m.skipped_koff = 0;
364
365 // Preserve DSP and timer synchronization
366 // TODO: verify that this really preserves it
367 int old_dsp_time = m.dsp_time + m.spc_time;
368 m.dsp_time = end - m.spc_time + skipping_time;
369 end_frame( end );
370 m.dsp_time = m.dsp_time - skipping_time + old_dsp_time;
371
372 dsp.write( SPC_DSP::r_koff, m.skipped_koff & ~m.skipped_kon );
373 dsp.write( SPC_DSP::r_kon , m.skipped_kon );
374 clear_echo();
375 }
376 #endif
377
378 return play( count, 0 );
379}
